fields.name: theme
fields.label: Domain / Topic
fields.short_description: Domain or topic of the dataset being cataloged.
fields.long_description: The theme or topic of the catalogue entry. Please select from an existing topic, such as Transportation, Housing, etc. Please refer to the taxonomy of topics available.

fields.short_description: Title for the Dataset.
fields.long_description: Title for the dataset. The value should be descriptive of the dataset. Vague or general terms should be avoided. Duplicate titles in a series should be postfixed with a counter. Often assigned by the creator or publisher.

fields.short_description: A description of the dataset.
fields.long_description: This property holds a descriptive text introducing the dataset, context, and if applicable, stakeholders. Often provided by the creator or publisher.

fields.short_description: Keywords/tags categorizing the dataset.
fields.long_description: Keywords/tags categorizing the dataset. Often provided by the creator or publisher. The keywords can be added, but suitable keywords should be selected from existing values, if possible. A controlled vocabulary of keywords, organized as a taxonomy, is created for each domain/topic.

fields.name: file_format
fields.label: Format (CSV, XLS, TXT, PDF, etc)
fields.short_description: File format of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Format of the dataset file can indicate its file type (e.g. csv, pdf, ttl). If multiple types are available, the types are separated by commas (“csv, ttl, pdf”).

fields.name: file_size
fields.label: Dataset Size
fields.short_description: Dataset size in megabytes.
fields.long_description: Total size of the datasets in this catalogue entry Saved as a decimal of megabtyes (MB).

fields.name: unique_metadata_identifier
fields.label: Metadata Identifier
fields.short_description: Metadata identifier – can be used as the unique identifier for catalogue entry
fields.long_description: Unique identifier for the metadata catalogue. Often assigned by the creator or publisher.

fields.name: published_date
fields.label: Published Date
fields.short_description: Published date of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Published date of the dataset is the data when the dataset was first made accessible to the public. Often provided by the creator or publisher.

fields.name: time_span_start
fields.label: Time Period Data Span (start date)
fields.short_description: Start date of the data in the dataset.
fields.long_description: First date the data was collected for. This is not the date it was collected but the earliest date of the data values.

fields.name: time_span_end
fields.label: Time Period Data Span (end date)
fields.short_description: End date of time data in the dataset.
fields.long_description: Last date the data was collected for. This is not the date it was collected but the latest date of the data values.

fields.name: geo_span
fields.label: GeoSpatial Area Data Span
fields.short_description: A spatial region or named place the dataset covers.
fields.long_description: This data represents the geospatial area the dataset covers. This may be captured as a data column or simply defined by the creator or publisher.

fields.name: access_category
fields.label: Access category
fields.short_description: Type of access granted for the dataset (open, closed, service, etc).
fields.long_description: Access category provides a description of the licensing rights for accessing the dataset. If the dataset is avaialble through a web service (e.g. API), state "Service" Often provided by the rights owner, creator or publisher.

fields.short_description: License used to access the dataset.
fields.long_description: License used to access the dataset. Often provided by the creator or publisher. A license should be selected from existing licenses.  A custom license can be added if an applicable license is not available. The licenses must be defined externally, meaning, a temporary or placeholder license or  should not be added.

fields.name: limits_on_use
fields.label: Limits on use
fields.short_description: Limits on use of data.
fields.long_description: Limits on use (e.g., academic purposes). Information provided generally provides more detail on the terms and access rights beyond the license. Usually provided by the rights owner, creator, or publisher.

fields.name: location
fields.label: Location
fields.short_description: Location of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Location where the dataset can be accessed, such as a URL.

fields.name: data_service
fields.label: Data Service
fields.short_description: Data service for accessing a dataset.
fields.long_description: Data service for accessing a dataset. This references the architecture being used to host and manage access to the datasets, such as CKAN, Dataverse, etc.

fields.name: owner
fields.label: Owner
fields.short_description: Owner of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Owner's name or authoring organization for the dataset.

fields.name: access_steward
fields.label: Contact Point
fields.short_description: Who to contact regarding access?
fields.long_description: The access rights steward is the point of contact (either a person or an organization) to gain access to the dataset. Usually provided by the rights owner, creator, or publisher.

fields.name: access_steward_email
fields.label: Contact Point Email
fields.short_description: The email to contact regarding access?
fields.long_description: The access rights steward is the point of contact (email of either a person or an organization) to gain access to the dataset. Usually provided by the rights owner, creator, or publisher.

fields.name: publisher
fields.label: Publisher
fields.short_description: Publisher of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Publisher's name or authoring organization for the dataset.

fields.name: publisher_email
fields.label: Publisher Email
fields.short_description: Email of the publisher.
fields.long_description: Email of the dataset's publisher. Can be used to contact the author directly.

fields.short_description: Author of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Author's name or authoring organization for the dataset.

fields.short_description: Email of the author.
fields.long_description: Email of the dataset's author. Can be used to contact the author directly.

fields.name: accessed_date
fields.label: Accessed At
fields.short_description: Date the data and metadata was accessed.
fields.long_description: Date the data and metadata was accessed. This date identifies when the dataset and metadata were reviewed for entry into CUDC. Usually, this is provided by data curator or the data owner if provided indirectly from the owner.

fields.name: unique_identifier
fields.label: Identifier
fields.short_description: Unique identifier for the dataset.
fields.long_description: Unique identifier for the dataset. Often assigned by the creator or publisher. Not necessarily persistent or globally unique.

fields.name: language
fields.label: Language
fields.short_description: Language(s) of the dataset
fields.long_description: Language(s) of the dataset capture what language the data is in. It does not reflect the language o the metadata associated with it.

fields.name: description_document
fields.label: Link to dataset description
fields.short_description: A URL to an external document describing the dataset.
fields.long_description: A URL to an external document describing the dataset. Often this would be a website that provides additional details about the dataset. It can also link to a document (e.g. PDF) or a resource of some sort (e.g. LinkedData object).

fields.name: persistent_identifier
fields.label: Persistent Identifier
fields.short_description: Data is identified by a persistent identifier.
fields.long_description: Data is identified by a persistent identifier. A unique identifier can be in any format, as long as it is unique within some context. Often, this is stored as a unique resource identifier (URI).

fields.name: global_unique_identifier
fields.label: Globally Unique Identifier
fields.short_description: Data is identified by a persistent and globally unique identifier.
fields.long_description: Data is identified by a persistent and globally unique identifier. A unique identifier can be in any format as long as it is globally unique. Often, this is stored as a unique resource identifier (URI).

fields.name: contains_individual_data
fields.label: Contains data about individuals
fields.short_description: Does the data hold data about individuals?
fields.long_description: Captures whether the dataset holds data about individuals in a population? If yes, the dataset is aggregated at the individual level. If not, the data is aggregated. This does not mean the individuals cannot be inferred from the dataset. Other metadata properties are required to indicate whether individuals can be inferred from the dataset or not.

fields.name: contains_identifiable_individual_data
fields.label: Contains data about identifiable individuals
fields.short_description: Does the data hold identifiable data about individual?
fields.long_description: Does the data hold identifiable individual data that can be used to uniquely identify an individual data was collected about? If yes, the dataset is not anonymized.

fields.name: contains_indigenous_data
fields.label: Contains Indigenous Data
fields.short_description: Does the data hold data about Indigenous communities?
fields.long_description: Does the data hold data about Indigenous communities? If yes, the dataset should comply with OCAP principles (Ownership, Control, Access, Possession). See https://fnigc.ca/ocap-training/ for more information.

fields.short_description: Version of the datatset
fields.long_description: A literal representing the version of this dataset. It can be a number (e.g. v1.1) a date (e.g. Jan 1, 2022) or a textual description (e.g. 'First version published for public use').

fields.short_description: Source of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Source where the dataset can be accessed, such as a URL.

fields.name: version_info
fields.label: Version notes
fields.short_description: Version notes about the dataset.
fields.long_description: Additional information about the version, such as date the dataset was published, reasons for publishing, changes from previous version, etc.

fields.name: version_dataset
fields.label: Is version of another dataset
fields.short_description: Link to dataset that it is a version of.
fields.long_description: Often a dataset is a version of another dataset. This new version may be an updated or revised in some other way, such as a processed version with additional analysis, aggregation level, or quality improvements. This property is a link to a dataset the catalogued dataset is an updated version of.

fields.name: dataset_versions
fields.label: Other versions
fields.short_description: Link to datasets that are versions of it.
fields.long_description: Often a dataset is a version of another dataset. This new version may be an updated or revised in some other way, such as a processed version with additional analysis, aggregation level, or quality improvements. This property is a link to a dataset the catalogued dataset is the original version of.

fields.name: provenance
fields.label: Provenance Text
fields.short_description: Provenance Text of the data.
fields.long_description: Provenance of the data, identifying who created the previous versions, who has used them, etc.

fields.name: provenance_url
fields.label: Provenance URL
fields.short_description: Provenance URL of the data.
fields.long_description: If there is additional documentation about the provenance of the catalogued dataset, this property stores a URL to the external location where this information is available.

fields.name: temporal_resolution
fields.label: Temporal resolution
fields.short_description: Describes how granular the date/time data in the dataset is.
fields.long_description: Describes how granular the date/time data in the dataset is. Usually, this explains the level of aggregation provided by the dataset. For example, time-series data can be by minute, hour, year, or season.

fields.name: geospatial_resolution_in_meters
fields.label: GeoSpatial resolution in meters
fields.short_description: Describes how granular (in meters) geospatial data is in the dataset.
fields.long_description: Describes how granular (in meters) geospatial data is in the dataset. Usually, this explains the level of aggregation provided by the dataset. For example, geospatial information can be stored in 1 meter detail, 5 meters, 1000 meters, etc.

fields.name: geospatial_resolution
fields.label: GeoSpatial resolution (in regions)
fields.short_description: Describes how granular (in regions) geospatial data is in the dataset.
fields.long_description: Describes how granular (in regions) geospatial data is in the dataset. Usually, this explains the level of aggregation provided by the dataset. For example, geospatial information can be at the city, province, region, or country level. It can also be stored as a polygon defined by longitude/latitude coordinates.

fields.name: indigenous_community_permission
fields.label: Indigenous Community Permission
fields.short_description: Who holds the Indigenous Community Permission. Who to contact regarding access to a dataset that has data about Indigenous communities.
fields.long_description: Who holds the Indigenous Community Permission. The Indigenous access rights steward is the point of contact (either a person or an organization) to gain access to the dataset. It is an agent that has the right to manage access rights to Indigenous data. That person can be Indigenous themselves or a non-Indigenous agent that acts as the steward for access rights to the data. Usually provided by the previous rights owner, creator, or publisher.

fields.name: community_steward
fields.label: Community Permission
fields.short_description: Community permission (who gave permission).
fields.long_description: Community permission identifies the person or contact information indicating who tocontact about gaining permission to use the data that belongs to an entire comunity. This comunity steward speaks on behalf of the enture community regarding access to the dataset.

fields.name: indigenous_span
fields.label: The Indigenous communities the dataset is about
fields.short_description: Indigenous communities from which data is derived.
fields.long_description: Indigenous communities from which data is derived. this represents the community coverage of the communities that provided the data or are the subject of data stored in the dataset.

fields.name: number_of_rows
fields.label: Number of data rows
fields.short_description: If tabular dataset, total number of rows.
fields.long_description: If tabular dataset, total number of data rows. Tabular could be a CSV file, an Excel file, a relational database, etc.

fields.name: number_of_columns
fields.label: Number of data columns
fields.short_description: If tabular dataset, total number of unique columns.
fields.long_description: If tabular dataset, total number of unique columns, across all sheets (if an Excel type file). Tabular could be a CSV file, an Excel file, a relational database, etc.

fields.name: number_of_cells
fields.label: Number of data cells
fields.short_description: If tabular dataset, total number of cells with data.
fields.long_description: If tabular dataset, total number of data cells with data, i.e. not empty cells. Tabular could be a CSV file, an Excel file, a relational database, etc.

fields.name: number_of_triples
fields.label: Number of data relations
fields.short_description: If RDF dataset, total number of triples.
fields.long_description: If RDF dataset, total number of triples.

fields.name: number_of_entities
fields.label: Number of entities
fields.short_description: If RDF dataset, total number of entities.
fields.long_description: If RDF dataset, total number of entities (i.e. concepts used in the dataset).

fields.name: number_of_properties
fields.label: Number of data properties
fields.short_description: If RDF dataset, total number of unique properties used by the triples.
fields.long_description: If RDF dataset, total number of unique properties used in this dataset.

fields.name: quality_annotation
fields.label: Data quality
fields.short_description: Describes the quality of the data in the dataset.
fields.long_description: Quality of the data can be a simple description (e.g. "high quality for 80%"), a simple scale (e.g. "3 out of 4") or specific values and metrics (e.g. "80% of cells re missing").

fields.name: quality_dimension_metric
fields.label: Metric for data quality
fields.short_description: A metric used to measure the quality of the data, such as missing values or invalid formats.
fields.long_description: Quality metrics can be any metrics used to measure the quality of the dataset as a whole. For example, the VIMO metrics are used to measure how many cells are valid, invalid, missing, or outliers.
